content: Right now, if you quote a message, it puts the whole thing in series of quote markers. So you get recursive nesting, like this: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/187312-wg-async/topic/sprint.20planning.202022-02-17/near/272295867

I personally work around this by (sometimes) manually editing the draft after hitting quote, and removing the inner level of quotation, like this: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/187312-wg-async/topic/sprint.20planning.202022-02-17/near/272295350
(note that the above started off by quoting this message: https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/187312-wg-async/topic/sprint.20planning.202022-02-17/near/272295117 )
it might be neat if this were a first class feature in the interface, rather than something I had to do by hand. People rarely benefit from six levels of quotation.
especially when its all colocated in one topic and it was recently in the conversation.
Hm, interesting. Do you find that it varies how many layers of quotation you want to keep/remove? Or do you generally just want to quote the outer layer?
Alternately, something like https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/19712 might help as a manual workaround.
It can vary, the same way email quotes can vary (trimming things that aren't relevant anymore). But I think there are reasonable defaults.
That issue would be awesome, yeah.
That issue would be awesome, yeah.
That issue would be awesome, yeah.

If I'm quoting a post less than a dozen messages back in the same topic, 2 levels of quotes suffice, or one level but the link to the second level minus the contents. If I'm quoting anything more distant I want all the levels of quote.
is that triple-awesome, or another bug to chase? :wink:
:rolling_eyes: sigh, definitely a mobile bug. I've seen that happen before.
Josh Triplett do you recall any details on what you saw when the triple-send bug happened?

Not exactly, but I recall things I've seen often and in proximity. The Zulip mobile app often gets into a specific state where it can't seem to fetch data from the server. I open a topic, and it shows the blue "n unread" bar at the top, and the tiled placeholder image that evokes the idea of messages, but never loads messages. In that state, I can go back to the view of topics, and try another topic, and it still doesn't load. The only way I've found to get out of that state is to close (task view then swipe away) and reopen the app.
Saw that a couple of times today, including once around the time that happened.
The only other thing I can think of is that I switched apps and back between the previous message, that message (+ its two duplicates), and the next.
(FWIW, I also see the 'unloadable anything' state relatively often, typically I think after coming back to Zulip after a little while)
In the browser it seems to reload the SPA after waking up from sleep.
